column4: hm i'm a bit frustrated nobody here is trying to help me with my gpanel problem
people come in and out of here all the time. restate your question every 10-15 minutes, and you'll likely find someone who can help before much longer.
well i ws used to get help here immediately - but ill try later thx
if you need help immediately, i imagine you can purchase support from Canonical.
what are the permissions of the directories /home/<username>/.gconf and /home/<username>/.gconfd?
they are rwx------- and owned by me - it cpompared that to another machine and this somehow seem ok
the thing ist also: i can change gconf keys but nut the ones for the panel apps
others seem to work
and the permissions of all subdirectories are similar?
yes
you haven't run X as root, or run the configuration editor via sudo, right?
the first thing not - the second thing i dunno
i might try that?
or rather not?
i wouldn't :-)
i think i did but i didnt change anything
my guess is that one of the registry files is owned by root. might be worth a look, anyway.
somehow i dont get where the config is coming from - i allready deleted the whole panel directories of the .gconf dir but nothing changed. should i try restarting gconfd?
did you touch .gconfd as well?
no
what is saved state in .gconfd? is itz also config info?
i don't know exactly what gconfd sticks in that directory. i've tried to learn as little as possible about gconf :-)
ok :)
